018package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.bucket;
019
020import static org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.CacheConfig.BUCKETCACHE_PERSIST_INTERVAL_KEY;
021import static org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.bucket.BucketCache.DEFAULT_ERROR_TOLERATION_DURATION;
022import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;
023import static org.junit.Assert.assertNull;
024import static org.junit.Assert.assertTrue;
025
026import org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration;
027import org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path;
028import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseClassTestRule;
029import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseConfiguration;
030import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseTestingUtil;
031import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.Waiter;
032import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.BlockCacheKey;
033import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.CacheTestUtils;
034import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.Cacheable;
035import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.testclassification.SmallTests;
036import org.junit.ClassRule;
037import org.junit.Test;
038import org.junit.experimental.categories.Category;
039
040/**
041 * Basic test for check file's integrity before start BucketCache in fileIOEngine
042 */
043@Category(SmallTests.class)
044public class TestRecoveryPersistentBucketCache {
045  @ClassRule
046  public static final HBaseClassTestRule CLASS_RULE =
047    HBaseClassTestRule.forClass(TestRecoveryPersistentBucketCache.class);
048
049  final long capacitySize = 32 * 1024 * 1024;
050  final int writeThreads = BucketCache.DEFAULT_WRITER_THREADS;
051  final int writerQLen = BucketCache.DEFAULT_WRITER_QUEUE_ITEMS;
052
053  @Test
054  public void testBucketCacheRecovery() throws Exception {
055    HBaseTestingUtil TEST_UTIL = new HBaseTestingUtil();
056    Path testDir = TEST_UTIL.getDataTestDir();
057    TEST_UTIL.getTestFileSystem().mkdirs(testDir);
058    Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
059    // Disables the persister thread by setting its interval to MAX_VALUE
060    conf.setLong(BUCKETCACHE_PERSIST_INTERVAL_KEY, Long.MAX_VALUE);
061    int[] bucketSizes = new int[] { 8 * 1024 + 1024 };
062    BucketCache bucketCache = new BucketCache("file:" + testDir + "/bucket.cache", capacitySize,
063      8192, bucketSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, testDir + "/bucket.persistence",
064      DEFAULT_ERROR_TOLERATION_DURATION, conf);
065    assertTrue(bucketCache.waitForCacheInitialization(1000));
066    assertTrue(
067      bucketCache.isCacheInitialized("testBucketCacheRecovery") && bucketCache.isCacheEnabled());
068
069    CacheTestUtils.HFileBlockPair[] blocks = CacheTestUtils.generateHFileBlocks(8192, 4);
070
071    CacheTestUtils.HFileBlockPair[] smallerBlocks = CacheTestUtils.generateHFileBlocks(4096, 1);
072    // Add four blocks
073    cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(bucketCache, blocks[0].getBlockName(), blocks[0].getBlock());
074    cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(bucketCache, blocks[1].getBlockName(), blocks[1].getBlock());
075    cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(bucketCache, blocks[2].getBlockName(), blocks[2].getBlock());
076    cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(bucketCache, blocks[3].getBlockName(), blocks[3].getBlock());
077    // saves the current state of the cache
078    bucketCache.persistToFile();
079    // evicts the 4th block
080    bucketCache.evictBlock(blocks[3].getBlockName());
081    // now adds a 5th block to bucket cache. This block is half the size of the previous
082    // blocks, and it will be added in the same offset of the previous evicted block.
083    // This overwrites part of the 4th block. Because we persisted only up to the
084    // 4th block addition, recovery would try to read the whole 4th block, but the cached time
085    // validation will fail, and we'll recover only the first three blocks
086    cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(bucketCache, smallerBlocks[0].getBlockName(),
087      smallerBlocks[0].getBlock());
088
089    // Creates new bucket cache instance without persisting to file after evicting 4th block
090    // and caching 5th block. Here the cache file has the first three blocks, followed by the
091    // 5th block and the second half of 4th block (we evicted 4th block, freeing up its
092    // offset in the cache, then added 5th block which is half the size of other blocks, so it's
093    // going to override the first half of the 4th block in the cache). That's fine because
094    // the in-memory backing map has the right blocks and related offsets. However, the
095    // persistent map file only has information about the first four blocks. We validate the
096    // cache time recorded in the back map against the block data in the cache. This is recorded
097    // in the cache as the first 8 bytes of a block, so the 4th block had its first 8 blocks
098    // now overridden by the 5th block, causing this check to fail and removal of
099    // the 4th block from the backing map.
100    BucketCache newBucketCache = new BucketCache("file:" + testDir + "/bucket.cache", capacitySize,
101      8192, bucketSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, testDir + "/bucket.persistence",
102      DEFAULT_ERROR_TOLERATION_DURATION, conf);
103    assertTrue(newBucketCache.waitForCacheInitialization(1000));
104
105    assertEquals(3, newBucketCache.backingMap.size());
106    assertNull(newBucketCache.getBlock(blocks[3].getBlockName(), false, false, false));
107    assertNull(newBucketCache.getBlock(smallerBlocks[0].getBlockName(), false, false, false));
108    assertEquals(blocks[0].getBlock(),
109      newBucketCache.getBlock(blocks[0].getBlockName(), false, false, false));
110    assertEquals(blocks[1].getBlock(),
111      newBucketCache.getBlock(blocks[1].getBlockName(), false, false, false));
112    assertEquals(blocks[2].getBlock(),
113      newBucketCache.getBlock(blocks[2].getBlockName(), false, false, false));
114    TEST_UTIL.cleanupTestDir();
115  }
116
117  @Test
118  public void testBucketCacheEvictByHFileAfterRecovery() throws Exception {
119    HBaseTestingUtil TEST_UTIL = new HBaseTestingUtil();
120    Path testDir = TEST_UTIL.getDataTestDir();
121    TEST_UTIL.getTestFileSystem().mkdirs(testDir);
122    Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
123    // Disables the persister thread by setting its interval to MAX_VALUE
124    conf.setLong(BUCKETCACHE_PERSIST_INTERVAL_KEY, Long.MAX_VALUE);
125    int[] bucketSizes = new int[] { 8 * 1024 + 1024 };
126    BucketCache bucketCache = new BucketCache("file:" + testDir + "/bucket.cache", capacitySize,
127      8192, bucketSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, testDir + "/bucket.persistence",
128      DEFAULT_ERROR_TOLERATION_DURATION, conf);
129    assertTrue(bucketCache.waitForCacheInitialization(10000));
130
131    CacheTestUtils.HFileBlockPair[] blocks = CacheTestUtils.generateHFileBlocks(8192, 4);
132
133    // Add four blocks
134    cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(bucketCache, blocks[0].getBlockName(), blocks[0].getBlock());
135    cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(bucketCache, blocks[1].getBlockName(), blocks[1].getBlock());
136    cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(bucketCache, blocks[2].getBlockName(), blocks[2].getBlock());
137    cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(bucketCache, blocks[3].getBlockName(), blocks[3].getBlock());
138    // saves the current state of the cache
139    bucketCache.persistToFile();
140
141    BucketCache newBucketCache = new BucketCache("file:" + testDir + "/bucket.cache", capacitySize,
142      8192, bucketSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, testDir + "/bucket.persistence",
143      DEFAULT_ERROR_TOLERATION_DURATION, conf);
144    assertTrue(newBucketCache.waitForCacheInitialization(10000));
145    assertEquals(4, newBucketCache.backingMap.size());
146    newBucketCache.evictBlocksByHfileName(blocks[0].getBlockName().getHfileName());
147    assertEquals(3, newBucketCache.backingMap.size());
148    TEST_UTIL.cleanupTestDir();
149  }
150
151  @Test
152  public void testValidateCacheInitialization() throws Exception {
153    HBaseTestingUtil TEST_UTIL = new HBaseTestingUtil();
154    Path testDir = TEST_UTIL.getDataTestDir();
155    TEST_UTIL.getTestFileSystem().mkdirs(testDir);
156    Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
157    // Disables the persister thread by setting its interval to MAX_VALUE
158    conf.setLong(BUCKETCACHE_PERSIST_INTERVAL_KEY, Long.MAX_VALUE);
159    int[] bucketSizes = new int[] { 8 * 1024 + 1024 };
160    BucketCache bucketCache = new BucketCache("file:" + testDir + "/bucket.cache", capacitySize,
161      8192, bucketSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, testDir + "/bucket.persistence",
162      DEFAULT_ERROR_TOLERATION_DURATION, conf);
163    assertTrue(bucketCache.waitForCacheInitialization(10000));
164
165    CacheTestUtils.HFileBlockPair[] blocks = CacheTestUtils.generateHFileBlocks(8192, 4);
166
167    // Add four blocks
168    cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(bucketCache, blocks[0].getBlockName(), blocks[0].getBlock());
169    cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(bucketCache, blocks[1].getBlockName(), blocks[1].getBlock());
170    cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(bucketCache, blocks[2].getBlockName(), blocks[2].getBlock());
171    cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(bucketCache, blocks[3].getBlockName(), blocks[3].getBlock());
172    // saves the current state of the cache
173    bucketCache.persistToFile();
174
175    BucketCache newBucketCache = new BucketCache("file:" + testDir + "/bucket.cache", capacitySize,
176      8192, bucketSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, testDir + "/bucket.persistence",
177      DEFAULT_ERROR_TOLERATION_DURATION, conf);
178    assertTrue(newBucketCache.waitForCacheInitialization(10000));
179
180    // Set the state of bucket cache to INITIALIZING
181    newBucketCache.setCacheState(BucketCache.CacheState.INITIALIZING);
182
183    // Validate that zero values are returned for the cache being initialized.
184    assertEquals(0, newBucketCache.acceptableSize());
185    assertEquals(0, newBucketCache.getPartitionSize(1));
186    assertEquals(0, newBucketCache.getFreeSize());
187    assertEquals(0, newBucketCache.getCurrentSize());
188    assertEquals(false, newBucketCache.blockFitsIntoTheCache(blocks[0].getBlock()).get());
189
190    newBucketCache.setCacheState(BucketCache.CacheState.ENABLED);
191
192    // Validate that non-zero values are returned for enabled cache
193    assertTrue(newBucketCache.acceptableSize() > 0);
194    assertTrue(newBucketCache.getPartitionSize(1) > 0);
195    assertTrue(newBucketCache.getFreeSize() > 0);
196    assertTrue(newBucketCache.getCurrentSize() > 0);
197    assertTrue(newBucketCache.blockFitsIntoTheCache(blocks[0].getBlock()).get());
198
199    TEST_UTIL.cleanupTestDir();
200  }
201
202  private void waitUntilFlushedToBucket(BucketCache cache, BlockCacheKey cacheKey)
203    throws InterruptedException {
204    Waiter.waitFor(HBaseConfiguration.create(), 12000,
205      () -> (cache.backingMap.containsKey(cacheKey) && !cache.ramCache.containsKey(cacheKey)));
206  }
207
208  // BucketCache.cacheBlock is async, it first adds block to ramCache and writeQueue, then writer
209  // threads will flush it to the bucket and put reference entry in backingMap.
210  private void cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(BucketCache cache, BlockCacheKey cacheKey,
211    Cacheable block) throws InterruptedException {
212    cache.cacheBlock(cacheKey, block);
213    waitUntilFlushedToBucket(cache, cacheKey);
214  }
215
216}
